dt: {bc}to increase in importance, popularity, or esteem

{bc}to develop rapidly in population and importance

dt: {bc}to increase greatly in size or number
{bc}to cause a rapid growth or increase of {bc}{sx|boost||}

dt: often used interjectionally to indicate suddenness

dt: {bc}a long spar used to extend the foot of a sail

{bc}a spar or outrigger connecting the tail surfaces and the main supporting structure of an aircraft

dt: {bc}a sound resembling an explosion produced when a shock wave formed at the nose of an aircraft traveling at supersonic speed reaches the ground
